title: 820-3115 No Backlight Killing Me
message:
Awesome work guys, just needed to say that. I usually find everything I need in this forum for my answers to the things I get stuck on. For the past two days I have been following all the 820-3115 No Back Light posts, and up until tonight, I'm at a dead end.

All voltages are correct, no break in any traces, parts all mentioned in other posts replaced, last part replaced tonight was SMC_LID which showed high so changed out the resistor and it now shows low on open lid. For the LIFE of me, I cannot figure out what I am missing, and I KNOW it's something stupid retarded, so I am finally reaching out for some help.

Board powers on on impact of magsafe green light, orange light, chimes, see faint image, boots... But I cannot for the life of me get the backlight to turn on. If any of you have any ideas on what on earth I am missing, please by all means see what I am missing. I built this board from the ground up with no green light, nothing and this is my last snag, the fun part was running a wire through the board for the RTC, if I can manage to find THAT what on earth am I missing on the backlight :(

**Forgot to mention I have tried the board in two different chassis....

title: 820-3115 No Backlight Killing Me
message: SMC_LID should be 3.4V and NOT low. So that is problem #1 that needs to be fixed.

title: 820-3115 No Backlight Killing Me
message: Ok, done, back at 3.3 for SMC_LID

title: 820-3115 No Backlight Killing Me
message: Need some voltages, BKL_EN BKL_PWM the actual voltage on the BKL line on the LCD connector,

title: 820-3115 No Backlight Killing Me
message: Ok, I will be opening my shop in an hour, I will give whatever you ask for sir.

title: 820-3115 No Backlight Killing Me
message:
BKL_EN is 0.11v
BKL_PWM is 3.3v
Pins 2,3,4 on LCD connector 3.3v
Pins 21,22 on LCD connector 0v and pins on both caps are going to ground

title: 820-3115 No Backlight Killing Me
message:
dukefawks, I greatly appreciate your time, I found out what is wrong, I need to re-do the solder mask for the LP8550, it didn't look to bad the first go around but I pulled it again and yeah, you can't make out where the pads go. So I have to make a blackout stencil and uv some solder masking so the balls don't decide to merge over.

You all keep up the great work. Inspiration to all of us in the repair business.

title: 820-3115 No Backlight Killing Me
message: Ok, this board is really upsetting me, remasked the area, put a new LP8550 and short to ground is gone from all BKL points, now Pin 21,22 on LCD connector is giving me 2.4v as well as Pin 1 on D9701

title: 820-3115 No Backlight Killing Me
message: Again, BKL_EN, BKL_PWM. Is there even an image present?

title: 820-3115 No Backlight Killing Me

BKL_PWM is 3.3v

Yes image is in background

title: 820-3115 No Backlight Killing Me
message: LCD_BKLT_EN present? F9700 good? Do a PRAM reset too.

title: 820-3115 No Backlight Killing Me
message:
LCD_BKLT_EN is 3.2v
F9700 is good with 12.5v on each side and PRAM was done three times in a row, no changes.

title: 820-3115 No Backlight Killing Me
message: can you check for short on C9782, just had a 3115 fixed for no backlight, fused does give 12.5v but C9782 was shorted when i measured both side of this cap. good idea to swap Q9706 if that cap is shorted.

title: 820-3115 No Backlight Killing Me
message: Voltages on Q9706?

title: 820-3115 No Backlight Killing Me
message:
C9782 no short on either pin

Q9706

Pin 1,2 - 3.17v
Pin 3 - 3.3v
Pin 4 - 3.3v
Pin 5 - 0v
Pin 6 - 0.6v

title: 820-3115 No Backlight Killing Me
message:
something wrong there. Pin 4 should have the same voltage as F9700 fuse.

#edit

btw, how did you measure C9782?

title: 820-3115 No Backlight Killing Me
message:
Pin 1,2,5,6 are tied together they should measure the same, please check again voltage.
Pin 4 is PPBUS_G3H witch you measured good at the fuse before.
Look if you don't have now a short on PPBUS_G3H because of the soldering.

You need to have ppbus_g3h 12.6V at pin 4 and Q9706 must open to let 12,6V appear on pins 1-2-5-6.
To have Q9706 open, Voltage divider must operate, this means pin 3 must be lower than pin 4.
​​​​​​

message:

You need to have ppbus_g3h 12.6V at pin 4 and Q9706 must open to let 12,6V appear on pins 1-2-5-6.
To have Q9706 open, Voltage divider must operate, this means pin 3 must be lower than pin 4.

title: 820-3115 No Backlight Killing Me
message:
Pin 3 should be way lower...something around 4V.
Could you check continuity (diode mode) between
pins 4 and 1-2-5-6?
pins 3 and 4? 
EDIT: With no power applied of course.

Pin 3 now shows 4v still no backlight....

message:

pin 2 of R9789?
pin 1 of R9731?
pin 2 of R9731?
What resistance do you measure on R9731?
​​​​

title: 820-3115 No Backlight Killing Me
message:
pin 2 of R9789 - 12.03v then drops to 0.1
pin 1 of R9731 - 0v
pin 2 of R9731 - 0v
What resistance do you measure on R9731 - 301K

title: 820-3115 No Backlight Killing Me
message:
Ok you seem to have a break in the trace between pin 1 of R9731 and pin 1-2-5-6 of Q9706, so 
Double check before and run a wire If no continuity, after that you should get around 3V at pin 2 of R9731 it's bkl_en.

title: 820-3115 No Backlight Killing Me
message:
Thank you for the suggestion, I didn't even notice the through the hole to other side was bad :-/
I have the 3v on pin 2 of R9731 still no backlight. I'm beginning to wonder if this board is just hopeless

title: 820-3115 No Backlight Killing Me
message: You fixed a bad trace. Now you go back to step 1 and check voltages again on Q9706 and see if it at least fixed that.

title: 820-3115 No Backlight Killing Me
message:
Q9706

Pin 1,2 - 12.5v
Pin 3 - 4.3v
Pin 4,5,6 - 12.5v

BKL_EN - 3.1v 
BKL_PWM - 3.2v

BKL Line LCD Pins 2,3,4 - 3.3v Pins 21,22 - 0.6v

title: 820-3115 No Backlight Killing Me
message: R0910, D9701 or L9701 is/are bad. Or any traces between them. R0910 is a common one to corrode.
